items.to_string:
Title: Prepare Narrated Recording for Current Agentic Capabilities

Value Statement: As a member of the MLOps team who enables generative AI agent deployment, I need the ability to present a recorded demo of our current agentic capabilities so that internal stakeholders can evaluate graph-based workflows, structured outputs, and MLKit enhancements.

Acceptance Criteria: A narrated demo recording is prepared and ready for inclusion in the PI demo, showcasing the current agentic workflow

Title: Prepare Narrated Recording for Generative AI Observability

Value Statement: As a member of the MLOps team who supports BIP and VA stakeholders, I need the ability to present a recorded demo of our generative AI observability stack so that internal teams can understand how monitoring, alerting, and tenant-specific notifications are handled in real-time.

Acceptance Criteria: A narrated demo recording is prepared and ready for inclusion in the PI demo, showcasing the generative AI observability workflow.

Value Statement: As a ml engineer I want stats in grafana for aria on Query Times so BIP AI can have data on usage for leadership.

AC: Grafana visualization made for Query Times

items.from_string: Title: Create a reusable Playwright step template
items.to_string:
Value Statement: As a DevOps engineer, I want to create a reusable step template for Playwright tests in Harness, so that I can standardize Playwright execution (using a pre-built image and configuration) and easily reuse this step across pipelines and accelerators.
 
Acceptance Criteria: Playwright Step Template Definition Given I am in the Harness template library When I create a new step template for Playwright Then: The step template is of the correct type (e.g., container/script step appropriate for running Playwright). The template can be versioned and stored in the shared template library. Pre-Built Image with Playwright Given there is a container image with Playwright pre-installed When I configure the step template Then: The template references this image in its configuration. The image includes all necessary Playwright dependencies (Node.js, browsers, drivers, fonts, etc.). The image location (registry URL/tag) can be configured or overridden via inputs if required. Configurable Playwright Command & Arguments
This issue is cloned by BIP-29810

Title: Create alert for model throttling on mlops dashboard

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer, I need to be notified if there is model throttling so I can proactively notifiy affected tenants.

Acceptance Criteria: - creat alert for model throttling and route to dev slack channel - alert description contains list of inference profiles throttling - manual tests and screenshots on JIRA ticket.

Title: Define Grafana alert thresholds for Bedrock inference requests based on service quotas and tenant usage.
Value Statement: As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer, I need data-driven alert thresholds for Bedrock inference requests that account for AWS service quota limits and per-tenant usage patterns so alerts are actionable, minimize noise, and prevent quota-related outages. 
Acceptance Criteria: - Gather and document relevant Bedrock service quotas and analyze historical tenant usage to establish a methodology for threshold calculation (including headroom, trends/seasonality, and safety margins). - Configure tenant grafana alerts for invocation requests using the derived thresholds.

Value Statement As a MLOps engineer, I want to review the bedrock code in mlkit bedrock manager to decide and edit which functionality to include so that tenants are able to effectively use the tools.

AC: - Create function to abstract away creation of agent all in one function - updating agent while enforcing tags, naming convention and inference profile, updating lambda with code zip file if needed, creating action group, updating lambda permissions, prepare and create agent alias - agent creation takes in simple config including agent and lambda ARNs and other params - function to invoke agent with option for streaming or not - updated tenant notebook to reflect changes

Title: Add Reusable Functional Code from Lambda Tutorial Notebook into mlkit Repository

Value Statement: As a BIP MLOps engineer, I want to extract and centralize reusable Lambda-related utility code from the Lambda Usage Tutorial Notebook into the shared mlkit repository, so that commonly used functions and classes can be easily imported and maintained across multiple projects without code duplication.

Description: The Lambda Usage Tutorial Notebook currently includes functional code (e.g., Lambda creation, configuration, and invocation helpers) that can be reused in other notebooks and pipelines. This task involves identifying such reusable code segments, refactoring them into standalone Python modules within the mlkit repository, and updating the tutorial notebook to import those utilities instead of redefining them locally. This will promote better maintainability, consistency, and reusability across all projects using Lambda or SageMaker automation.

Acceptance Criteria: Code Identification - Review the Lambda Usage Tutorial Notebook and identify all code components suitable for reuse (e.g., Lambda creation, invocation, S3 interaction, logging utilities). Refactoring and Module Creation - Move reusable logic into the mlkit repository under an appropriate directory - Ensure code is modular, well-documented, and follows internal coding standards. - Functions and classes should include docstrings and type hints. Testing - Add or update unit tests in the mlkit repo to verify the moved code functions as expected. Notebook Update - Update the Lambda Usage Tutorial Notebook to import the refactored functions/classes from mlkit. Documentation - Add or update README/documentation within mlkit describing the new utilities and their usage.
This issue is cloned by BIP-29592

items.from_string: Research and enable (if possible) Comprehend usage tagging
items.to_string: Research and explore enabling comprehend usage tagging
AC: Create tagged comprehend project and validate in cost explorer that costs are being tracked. Work with infra to create tagging enforced policy for comprehend use.

Title: DynamoDB functional code added to MLKit

Value Statement: As a Tenant ML Engineer who wants to leverage DynamoDB for their use case, I need to integrate the DynamoDB code from the tutorial notebook into MLKit so that tenants can further leverage DynamoDB to validate and run create, read, update, and delete operations.

Acceptance Criteria: -When DynamoDB logic from the tutorial notebook is incorporated, users have the ability to manage DynamoDB operations within MLKit. -MLKit supports validation of basic DynamoDB operations such as create, read, update, and delete. -The DynamoDB tutorial is updated to demonstrate the new MLKit-based DynamoDB functionality.

items.from_string:
Title: DynamoDB functional code added to MLKit

Value Statement: As a Tenant ML Engineer who wants to leverage DynamoDB for their use case, I need to integrate the DynamoDB code from the tutorial notebook into MLKit so that tenants can further leverage DynamoDB to validate and run create, read, update, and delete operations.

Acceptance Criteria: -When DynamoDB logic from the tutorial notebook is incorporated, users have the ability to manage DynamoDB operations within MLKit. -MLKit supports validation of basic DynamoDB operations such as create, read, update, and delete. -The DynamoDB tutorial is updated to demonstrate the new MLKit-based DynamoDB functionality.
items.to_string:
Title:
DynamoDB example tutorial notebook

Value Statement:
As a BIP-AI tenant who wants to persist and query application data efficiently, I need to learn how to use Amazon DynamoDB within BIP-AI to design tables, perform CRUD operations, and implement scalable, low-latency data access patterns for AI-driven workflows.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Jupyter notebook explaining core DynamoDB concepts relevant to BIP-AI (table design, keys, capacity, indexes).
- Example setup: create a table and perform basic CRUD using the AWS SDK from BIP-AI.
- Query and scan demonstrations, including key conditions and pagination.
- Use of at least one secondary index aligned to an example access pattern.
- Basic observability and security: CloudWatch metrics/logs, and least-privilege IAM guidance.

Title: Enable EventBridge for BDA Project Invocation in mlkit Bedrock module

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer, I need the mlkit Bedrock module to emit BDA Project Invocation events to EventBridge so downstream systems can react to invocations with standardized, observable, and decoupled event-driven workflows.

Acceptance Criteria: - Update the mlkit Bedrock module to publish BDA Project Invocation events to EventBridge - update unit tests accordingly

items.from_string: Fix Crossplane manager EntraID group permissions to enable tenant resource visibility
items.to_string:
Fix Crossplane manager EntraID group permissions to enable tenant resource visibility

Story: As a tenant user, I want to view my Sagemaker Domains and other resources on the BIP-AI Gateway so that I can manage and access the resources provisioned for my team.

Assumptions: - The Python-based implementation demonstrates the correct EntraID group-to-tenant mapping pattern - The issue affects all resource types retrieved through the same route, not just Domains - DEV environment has sufficient diversity of user roles and EntraID groups to validate the fix.

Acceptance Criteria: - Given a tenant user with an EntraID group when I navigate to the Domains page then I see all Sagemaker Domains associated with my tenant - Given a tenant user when the manager processes my request then it correctly maps my EntraID group to the corresponding tenant name - Given the fixed Go-based manager when it retrieves tenant resources then it applies the same authorization logic as the working Python implementation - Given a tenant user with access to multiple resource types when I view each resource page then all resources associated with my tenant are visible - Given the updated manager deployed in SBX when I test resource retrieval then tenant resources display correctly for test users - Given the updated manager deployed in DEV when developers with diverse roles test then each user sees only their tenant resources.

Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable) - Documentation updated (README / runbook as applicable) - Security and access controls reviewed - Dependencies updated and migrations applied

items.from_string: Refactor Usage protection to parent resources and add deletion protection flag to enhance protection and intended deletion
items.to_string:
Refactor Usage protection to parent resources and add deletion protection flag to enhance protection and intended deletion

Story: As an infrastructure engineer, I want Usage constraints applied only to Claims and Composites so that resources are protected from unintended deletion while remaining simple to remove when intentional.

Assumptions: - Some compositions already implement a deletion protection flag pattern that can be standardized - ArgoCD is the primary tool causing unintended deletion flags on child resources - Claims are the preferred parent resource when available, otherwise Composites are used

Acceptance Criteria: - Given a composition that uses Claims when I apply Usage constraints then they protect only the Claim resource and storage resources - Given a composition without Claims when I apply Usage constraints then they protect only the Composite resource and storage resources - Given all BIP-AI compositions when I review Usage definitions then child resources no longer have Usage constraints except for storage - Given a composition with the deletion protection flag when I set it to disable protection then all Usage constraints are bypassed to allow deletion - Given a composition with the deletion protection flag when I leave it unset then it defaults to enabled and Usage constraints remain active - Given all BIP-AI compositions when I review the XRD then each includes a standardized deletion protection parameter matching the existing pattern - Given the refactored compositions deployed in SBX when I test deletion scenarios then protected resources block deletion and unprotected resources delete successfully

Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (integration testing in SBX) - Documentation updated (README / runbook covering Usage patterns and deletion protection flag) - Dependencies updated and migrations applied

### Title Update Tenant API for crossplane autotagger to retrieve tags by ApplicationId ### Value Statement As an infrastructure engineer who automates resource tagging, I need the ability to retrieve tenant tags by ApplicationId through the Tenant API so that I can enable the crossplane autotagger to apply consistent tags to resources.

### Acceptance Criteria A new API route is created /tenans/\{ApplicationId}/tags which returns the tags object

items.from_string:
### Title
Design crossplane composition architecture for kubernetes app deployments

### Value Statement
As an infrastructure engineer who deploys applications to kubernetes, I need to create a design for crossplane compositions so that I can understand the architecture before implementation.

### Acceptance Criteria

An architecture diagram is created showing the crossplane composition structure
A design document outlines the composition components, resources, and workflows
Design includes patterns for kubernetes app deployments using crossplane
Design is reviewed and approved by the team

### Assumptions
None.

### Dependencies
None.

### Notes
This is a planning and design story that will inform the implementation in a following ticket

Title: Deploy gateway to mgmt cluster for AI platform access

### Value Statement
As an infrastructure engineer who deploys platform services, I need the ability to deploy the gateway to the mgmt cluster so that I can make the AI platform available at the production URL.

### Acceptance Criteria
When a user navigates to https://ai.bip.va.gov, the user has the ability to access the gateway running on the mgmt cluster.

Gateway is deployed and running on the mgmt cluster
Pods are healthy and stable

Title Deploy image-based SPA Classifier Lambda to UAT for integration testing Value Statement As a SPA engineer who maintains classifier services across environments, I need the ability to run the SPA Classifier as an image-based Lambda in UAT so that business can validate functionality, performance, and integrations against the same containerized runtime we plan to use in higher environments. Acceptance Criteria When a user invokes the SPA Classifier endpoint in UAT, the request is served by an image-based Lambda deployment (not a ZIP-based Lambda).

Title Deploy image-based SPA Agentic Lambda to UAT for integration testing Value Statement As a SPA engineer who maintains classifier services across environments, I need the ability to run the SPA Agentic as an image-based Lambda in UAT so that business can validate functionality, performance, and integrations against the same containerized runtime we plan to use in higher environments. Acceptance Criteria When a user invokes the SPA Agentic endpoint in UAT, the request is served by an image-based Lambda deployment (not a ZIP-based Lambda).

Title Create BAT PPD API Gateway endpoint for SPA Classifier for downstream Flask App Value Statement As a SPA SE who exposes classifier capabilities to downstream applications, I need the ability to provide a stable BAT API Gateway endpoint for the SPA Classifier so that the external Flask app team can configure their app to call an API. Acceptance Criteria When a user calls the BAT PPD SPA Classifier API endpoint directly with a valid test payload, the user has the ability to receive a 200 response with the expected classifier payload.

items.from_string:
title: Gen-Ann: Support UserMetrics job SQL development in ProdTest

VS: As a platform SE for the Gen-Ann tenant, I want to provide configuration, deployment, and observability support so the tenant  can iterate on their User Metrics module logic (SQL, etc.) in Prodtest via standalone Sagemaker job runs, and then integrate the finalized module into the Sagemaker pipeline for deployment, ensuring a smooth path from module testing to pipeline execution.

AC:
- Logs and metrics for the standalone job are visible in CloudWatch
- UserMetricsPull standalone job has satisfactory performance in ProdTest.
items.to_string:
title: Gen-Ann: Support UserMetrics job SQL development in ProdTest

VS: As a platform SE for the Gen-Ann tenant, I want to provide configuration, deployment, and observability support so the tenant can iterate on their User Metrics module logic (SQL, etc.) in Prodtest via standalone Sagemaker job runs, and then integrate the finalized module into the Sagemaker pipeline for deployment, ensuring a smooth path from module testing to pipeline execution.

AC:
 - Conduct working sessions with the tenant to validate real DB connectivity in Prodtest and successful data retrieval.
 - Confirm with the tenant complete platform enablement and a repeatable method for them to iterate on their business logic independently without platform support

### Title Implement crossplane composition for kubernetes app deployments

### Value Statement As an infrastructure engineer who automates application deployments, I need the ability to use a crossplane composition for kubernetes apps so that I can deploy applications consistently and efficiently.

### Acceptance Criteria When a user creates a claim using the k8s-app composition, the user has the ability to deploy a kubernetes application following the approved design. The k8s-app crossplane composition is implemented according to the design document from <DESIGN TICKET ID HERE> Composition includes all resources defined in the design document Documentation is updated with usage examples and patterns Automated or manual tests validate the composition deploys applications successfully ### Dependencies This story is dependent on the completion of: <DEISGN TICKET ID HERE> (Design document)

Title: Implement crossplane composition for kubernetes app deployments

Value Statement: As an infrastructure engineer who automates application deployments, I need the ability to use a crossplane composition for kubernetes apps so that I can deploy applications consistently and efficiently.

Acceptance Criteria: When a user creates a claim using the k8s-app composition, the user has the ability to deploy a kubernetes application following the approved design. The k8s-app crossplane composition is implemented according to the design document from <DEISGN TICKET ID HERE> Composition includes all resources defined in the design document Documentation is updated with usage examples and patterns Automated or manual tests validate the composition deploys applications successfully

Dependencies: This story is dependent on the completion of: <DEISGN TICKET ID HERE> (Design document)
items.to_string:

items.from_string: Develop BIP-AI AWS provider config and IRSA to maintain composition functionality after platform deprecation
items.to_string:
Develop BIP-AI AWS provider config and IRSA to maintain composition functionality after platform deprecation

Story: As an infrastructure engineer, I want to create and deploy our own AWS provider config and IRSA role so that our Crossplane compositions continue to function independently after the platform deprecates the shared provider config.

Assumptions: - Platform deprecation timeline allows for SBX testing and validation before cutover - Current compositions use a consistent provider config reference pattern that can be systematically replaced - Required AWS permissions for BIP-AI use-cases can be identified from existing composition resource types

Acceptance Criteria: - Given BIP-AI infrastructure requirements when I define the IRSA role then it includes only the minimum AWS permissions needed for our composition resource types - Given the new provider config when I deploy it with our compositions then it successfully authenticates using the BIP-AI IRSA role - Given all existing BIP-AI compositions when I update their provider config references then each composition references the new BIP-AI provider config - Given the updated compositions when I deploy them in SBX then all resources provision successfully using the new provider config and IRSA - Given a composition deployment when it uses the new provider config then no references to the deprecated platform provider config remain - Given the new IRSA role when I review its permissions then it follows least-privilege principles for the APIs accessed by our compositions

Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (integration testing in SBX) - Documentation updated (README / runbook covering provider config deployment and IRSA role configuration) - Security and access controls reviewed - Dependencies updated and migrations applied

Title: Deploy mlops-manager to mgmt cluster for MLOps service access

Value Statement: As an infrastructure engineer who deploys platform services, I need the ability to deploy the MLOPS manager to the mgmt cluster so that I can make MLOps services available through the AI platform.

Acceptance Criteria: When a user accesses the MLOPS manager endpoints, the user has the ability to interact with both the API and frontend services. MLOPS manager API is deployed and running on the mgmt cluster Pods are healthy and stable

items.from_string: Deploy MLOPS API to MGMT cluster

items.to_string: Create IaC for MLOps API in MGMT cluster

Title: Add code formatting, test coverage and validation to github CI checks for EVA's repository Value Statement: As a BIP AI mlops developer who supports EVA, I need a CI pipeline that checks code formatting, runs test validation and checks test coverage on EVA's PRs so that I can ensure new code meets testing and formatting requirements. AC: Checks are added for black formatting, test coverage, and runs tests to validate passing tests to be run on new PR.

Ticket Name: TERA endpoint cleanup Value Statement: "As a TERA or BIP-AI engineer when I run the ci/cd process to create a new TERA NRT endpoint the previously created endpoint should be removed to prevent additional charges. This ticket is to delete any existing endpoints that are no longer being used by the TERA team and investigate if an automatic endpoint cleanup step can be added to the current ci/cid pipeline as well as updating the API Gateway configuration" AC - Screenshot showing endpoints for TERA cleaned up in dev, stage + preprod - Write up of investigation into testing automated cleanup process - PR including automated removal of endpoints if possible

As BIP Eng, we would like to migrate environments into different clusters as needed so that tenants can have better isolation.

_Acceptance Criteria:_
 # Assess current environment cluster distribution
 # Plan migration strategy for tenant isolation
 # Create automated migration scripts and procedures
 # Test migration process in lower environments
 # Execute production migrations with minimal downtime
 # Validate tenant isolation and performance post-migration

_Associated GitHub Repositories:_
* bip-infrastructure: Cluster provisioning and migration automation
* bip-tooling-crossplane-apis: Multi-cluster API management
* bip-tenant-intake: Tenant environment configuration

_Notes_

items.from_string:
**Story:** As a BIP-AI Infra Cloud Engineer, I want a step-by-step user guide for accessing BIP domains via the SBX proxy so that team members can independently utilize the proxy for infrastructure testing and administration.

## Assumptions

- SSM proxy access permissions are already configured for mlops-admins role
- Team members have basic familiarity with AWS CLI and SSM concepts
- Confluence is the preferred documentation platform for team guides
- Both MacOS and Windows users exist on the team

## Acceptance Criteria

- **Given** a team member with mlops-admins role **when** following the user guide prerequisites **then** all required tools and permissions are properly configured

- **Given** the user guide **when** a MacOS user follows the step-by-step instructions **then** they successfully establish an SSM session to the SBX proxy and access BIP domains

- **Given** the user guide **when** a Windows user follows the step-by-step instructions **then** they successfully establish an SSM session to the SBX proxy and access BIP domains

- **Given** each documented step **when** tested by the author **then** the step executes successfully and produces the expected outcome

- **Given** the completed guide **when** published to Confluence **then** it is accessible to all team members and includes proper tags for discoverability

- **Given** the guide publication **when** shared with the team **then** notification is sent via appropriate team communication channels

## Definition of Done

- [ ] All acceptance criteria met
- [ ] Guide includes comprehensive prerequisites section
- [ ] Platform-specific instructions provided for MacOS and Windows where differences exist
- [ ] All steps tested and validated by author
- [ ] Guide published to Confluence with proper formatting and navigation
- [ ] Team notification completed
- [ ] Stretch goal: One MacOS and one Windows user successfully tested the guide (if time permits)
items.to_string:
{*}**Story**{*}: As a BIP-AI Infra/Cloud Engineer, I want to identify and fix the root cause of the access denied error preventing exam-agent from deploying Bedrock Agents and Knowledge Bases in preprod so that the tenant can successfully deploy their agents using their execution role.

{*}**Acceptance Criteria**{*}:
- Given the exam-agent execution role when attempting to create Agents and Knowledge Bases then the root cause of the access denied error is identified and documented
- Given the root cause is identified when a fix is developed then the fix is validated in DEV environment with successful agent and knowledge base creation
- Given the fix is validated in DEV when applied to PREPROD then exam-agent can successfully deploy Bedrock Agents and Knowledge Bases without access denied errors
- Given the fix is applied to all upper environments then no existing resources are disrupted and the fix functions correctly
- Given the fix is deployed to all environments when implementation is complete then findings and resolution are reported to team leads
- Given the issue is resolved when documentation review is performed then relevant documentation is updated to reflect the fix and prevent recurrence

{*}**Definition of Done**{*}:
- All acceptance criteria met
- Documentation updated (troubleshooting findings, fix details, runbook updates)
- Telemetry / logging reviewed to confirm successful deployments post-fix
- Security and access controls reviewed (IAM policy changes verified)
- Hotfix applied to preprod, stage, and prod without disrupting existing resources

items.from_string:
Value Statement: As as a BIP MLOps engineer, I want a tutorial Jupyter notebook that demonstrates how to create, configure, and invoke AWS Lambda functions, so that I can quickly understand and test Lambda integrations for data processing, SageMaker jobs, and other automation workflows.

Description: Develop a step-by-step tutorial notebook showcasing how to use AWS Lambda within our environment. The notebook should walk users through Lambda creation, permissions setup, event triggers, and function invocation from Python. It should include clear explanations and example code blocks to help users learn and replicate the process. This tutorial will serve as an internal reference for teams integrating Lambda functions with SageMaker, Bedrock, and related services.

Acceptance Criteria: Notebook Structure - Notebook is created in Jupyter format (.ipynb) and stored in the tenant. Sections include: - Introduction / Overview of Lambda - Creating a Lambda function (step-by-step) - Setting IAM roles and permissions - Invoking the function programmatically (via boto3) - Example: triggering a SageMaker Processing job or workflow Code Examples Includes fully functional Python code cells for: - Creating and deploying a Lambda function - Testing invocation and handling responses - Example Lambda function demonstrates reading from and writing to S3. Documentation - Inline markdown explanations clarify each step. - Includes guidance on debugging, logs (CloudWatch), and cost monitoring. - References official AWS docs and internal best practices if available.
items.to_string:
AC: 

Completed work:

Implemented the app and created the ECR but unable to get the service account working in the pod

Remaining work:
 * debug and fix service account
 * - test from notebook
 * - update tutorial

items.from_string:
Title: Fix and Generalize Fetch Operations in Gen-AI Module

Value Statement: As a tenant user who retrieves resources for use case development, I need the ability to fetch only the resources associated with my tenant across knowledgebases, Bedrock projects, agents, and any other bedrock associated resources so that data access is accurate, consistent, and aligned with tenant-specific permissions.

Acceptance Criteria: -When a tenant fetches resources through the gen-ai module, only tenant-associated resources are listed across knowledgebases, Bedrock projects, and agents. -When the updated fetch logic is deployed, running tenant notebooks in Bedrock confirms correct and complete resource retrieval. -Documentation in the gen-ai module is updated to reflect the new fetch behavior and tenant filtering logic. -manual validation steps are included in Bedrock notebooks to confirm functionality.
items.to_string:
Title:  Create domain environment setup unified pipelineValue Statement: As an MLOps Engineer on the BIP-AI team, I want to create a unified pipeline for domain environment setup so that a domain can easily be provisioned.AC: A single Jenkins pipeline is created in all environments that attaches the BIP AI Stable Jupyterlab and CodeEditor LCCs and attaches the custom image all in one combined pipeline.
This Jenkinsfile should live in the BIP AI LCCs repo, and documentation should be added on how to run this pipeline
Should be able to be run on new domains as well as updating existing domains, and should be run automatically when a new mlkit version is released
